name: Keys
description: A set of questions on the concept of Keys
author: WSBT

questions.title: What are the some types of keys in Flutter?
What are some use cases for global keys in Flutter?
answers: Global keys can help preserve states when a widget is relocated
Global keys can be used to find another widget on screen
candidates: Global keys can be used to measure device screen size
Global keys can be used to access global settings in iOS and Android

questions.title: Which type of key should be used to access the state of an ancestor widget?
candidates: LocalKey
PrivateKey
InheritedKey

questions.title: What is the potential risk of using Global Keys excessively?
candidates: It could potentially mix widget states.
It could change the order of items in `ListView` widgets.
It could reduce the effectiveness of `KeyedSubTree` widget.

questions.title: When should Local Keys be used in Flutter?
answers: When new widgets are inserted or removed in a list
candidates: When we need to preserve widget state across different screens
When layout-related tasks need to be performed more efficiently
When a widget state need to be retained after the widget is destroyed

questions.title: What's the purpose of the `key` parameter in widgets?
answers: To match new widget configuration with old widget states
candidates: To correctly associate a parent widget and its children
To perform encryption when storing widget data
To ensure end-to-end encryption during widget layout

questions.title: What is an example purpose of `ValueKey` in Flutter?
answers: To keep track of widgets in an list that can be reordered
candidates: To keep track of a global variable for widget
To keep track of a widget when it appears on a different page
To keep track of widget state when they become invisible for the user

questions.title: What differentiates `ObjectKey` from `ValueKey`?
answers: ObjectKey is compared with object identity while ValueKey uses equals comparison
candidates: ObjectKey can be used to store any object while ValueKey must store primitive values
ObjectKey is used for storing UI objects while ValueKey is used for data binding
ObjectKey is stored in memory heap while ValueKey is stored on memory stack
